title: In New England, Republicans Run as Moderates, Pushing to Flip More Seats
description: A handful of Republicans are making headway in traditionally Democratic strongholds by distancing themselves from the right wing of their party. Can they succeed?
dc:creator: Stephanie Lai
media:credit: Hilary Swift for The New York Times
media:description: “I want to work with Democrats and Republicans,” said George Logan, a Republican running for Congress in Connecticut.
